body.p: When the lymphatic structures of a limb are blocked due to tumors, what can result?

multiple_choice.choice: Abnormally high lymph drainage from the distal region
Severe localized edema distal to the blockage of that limb
Shrinkage of tissues distal in the limb to the blockage, due to inadequate delivery of lymph
Increased pressure in the lymphatics distal to the blockage

feedback.p: Incorrect. If the lymph vessel is blocked there would be no drainage.
Correct. Blockage of lymph vessels provokes edema, which is the accumulation of fluid in the tissues.
Incorrect. Tissues would not shrink for inadequate lymph delivery.
Incorrect. Pressures tend to decrease distal to blockages.

body.p: The movements of fluids and molecules out of the blood capillaries and into the interstitial fluid obey the laws of chemistry and physics. High pressure in the capillary would physically force fluid out. Which chemical changes would make it more likely that fluid will leave the blood capillary and enter the tissues?

multiple_choice.choice: Drinking too much water while running a marathon
Kidney failure resulting in increased levels of circulating urea
Intake of large amounts of caffeine

feedback.p: Incorrect. A high-salt diet would increase the level of salt circulating in the blood and fluid would be retained in the vessel.
Correct. Overhydration will result in the blood being more dilute than the tissues, creating an osmotic gradient that allows fluids to leave the blood and enter the tissues.
Incorrect. Kidney failure would put more urea and ammonia ( small molecules) in the blood, raising its osmotic pressure. The result is that fluid would leave the tissues and enter the blood.
Incorrect. Caffeine is a diuretic, causing fluids to leaviethe body and create a potential for dehydration.
